review: I bought a smart tv but the apps loaded too slowly and applications such as Netflix buffered too much without actually having connection issues. I read that fire tv had the fastest processor of all streaming media players available. So far I'm very pleased. Much faster loading of applications and no buffering issues. I now regret having bought a smart tv when I should have just bought a standard hdtv with a fire tv media player instead.
author: Rupert

review: Amazon's Fire TV works great.  Unfortunately,  I cannot rank it higher because I have been unable to mirror any Android device on my Fire TV. All devices are running Android 4.4.2 or higher.  I have tried to connect the following devices: Samsung galaxy S3, samsung galaxy S4, Samsung Galaxy S5, and Samsung Galaxy Note 2014. All devices are able to find the Fire TV, but then give a "failed to connect" error when you try to mirror the devices. I contacted Amazon about this issue,  and they said that  Samsung devices may only work with Samsung's AllShare Cast Hub and not other Miracast-capable devices. I tried that,  but it also did not work.
